title: Interpret interval for mean adult work hours

content.question: Which of the following statements is a correct interpretation of the interval?

choices.label: Ninety-five percent of all employed adults work between <math alttext="41.18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>41.18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours and <math alttext="42.63" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours per week.

The probability is <math alttext="0.95" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> that a sample of size <math alttext="1,501" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>501</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> will produce a mean between <math alttext="41.18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>41.18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours and <math alttext="42.63" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours.

Of all samples of size <math alttext="1,501" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>501</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> taken from the population, <math alttext="95%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the samples will have a mean between <math alttext="41.18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>41.18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours and <math alttext="42.63" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours.

We are <math alttext="95%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the mean number of hours worked per week for employed adults in the sample is between <math alttext="41.18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>41.18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours and <math alttext="42.63" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours.

We are <math alttext="95%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the mean number of hours worked per week for all employed adults is between <math alttext="41.18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>41.18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours and <math alttext="42.63" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours.

content.answer: We are <math alttext="95%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the mean number of hours worked per week for all employed adults is between <math alttext="41.18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>41.18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours and <math alttext="42.63" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.63</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
